value.title: Write if statements like a Pro in Power Query

value.title: Slicers vs. Slicer Pane vs. Filter Pane! Which is faster?
value.excerpt: You have different options in Power BI when it comes to slicers and filters. Just put the slicer on the report, use a slicer panel or have them in the filter pane. But which one is faster??? Patrick explores a few scenarios to think about!  Should you hide the filter pane in Power BI? https://greyskullanalytics.com/should-you-hide-the-filter-pane-in-power-bi/

value.title: Specifying multiple filter conditions in CALCULATE
value.excerpt: The filter arguments in CALCULATE can reference multiple columns from the same table in a single predicate: This is possible since March 2021 in Power BI, before that it was possible to filter a single column reference.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/705207?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Using Power BI gateways to connect to data sources
value.excerpt: Learn all about the On-Premises Data Gateway and how it is used with the Power BI service. The Power BI gateway can be used to refresh imported data as well as allow you to use DirectQuery or connect live to an Analysis Services mode.

topItems.title: Get started with the Power BI Gateway
topItems.excerpt: Get to know what the Power BI Gateway is along with how to get it setup for scheduled refresh of imported data.  Free Gateway Cube Sheet: https://guyinacu.be/gatewaystartpdf  Gateway Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-onprem  Gateway sizing: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/gateway-onprem-sizing

value.excerpt: Patrick looks at the What if parameters in Power BI Desktop to help you solve interesting questions in your Power BI reports. value.title: Conditional Formatting with Field Parameters in Power BI???
value.excerpt: You are excited about Field Parameters in Power BI, but then realize you can't use conditional formatting with them. What the french toast! Don't despair! Patrick and Adam have some ways to get this working.  Matthias K. Question https://youtu.be/ksmNfa_K8GQ?t=1011  Let report readers use field parameters

value.title: Here's a BANANAS report design idea!
value.excerpt: There are many things you can do in a Power BI report that aren't super complex. Here are a few ideas to get you thinking! If Adam can do this, you definitely can! value.title: Looking at Power BI Many to Many
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick takes a look at Power BI Many to Many relationships. This was part of the July 2018 Power BI Desktop release and can enable some awesome capabilities. Patrick looks at why you may not want to use Power BI Many to Many even though you think you do.  Many to Many documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-many-to-many-relationships

value.title: Populate a Power BI parameter list using a query
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how to populate a Power BI parameter list using a query. value.title: TAME the the beast that is DAX in Power BI (aka how to learn DAX)
value.excerpt: We know that DAX, in Power BI, can be intimidating. We've been there. Patrick shows you how you can learn DAX using what you have available today and TAME the beast that is DAX!  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/tamedaxsample  DAX.Guide: https://dax.guide  DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/  DAX
